intro: Polygala laureola var. oxyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bead-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
